{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = TL-WN851N-01.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = 300Mbps Wireless N PCI Adapter |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = TP-LINK_TL-WN851N_v2 |wikipedia = |brand = TP-LINK |model = TL-WN851N |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v2 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |sernum = |wlclass = N300 |series = |if = PCI |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = |vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 0029 |subvendor_id = 168c |subdevice_id = 2091 |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = TE7WN851NV2 |icid = 8853A-WN851N |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 94:0C:6D |chip1 = Atheros;AR9223; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 07/03/2010 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The FCC internal photos for this device are identical to the [[TP-LINK TL-WN851N v1]]. However, one of the external photos differs. There was presumed to have been an error during filing. "2052500242" and "Rev:2.0" is silkscreened on the card in the sole viable FCC external photo.
"MODEL:11N PCI Adapter-7(AR3) B" and "REV:2.2sp1" is silkscreened on the board in the sample images provided by '''TP-LINK'''. [http://forum.ubuntu-fr.org/viewtopic.php?id=426181 Subsystem noted as 168c:2091]
[http://forums.debian.net/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=55082 and again (+ 94:0C:6D OUI)] [http://spline.fli4l.dev.narkive.com/xjTZkFSh/fli4l-3-5-0-rev18440-tp-link-tl-wn861n-v2-0 and again (w/ same OUI)] [[Category:English Documentation]]
